These terms and conditions apply to the use of this Website and by accessing this Website and/or placing an order you agree to be bound by the terms and conditions set out below. If you do not agree to be bound by these terms and conditions, you may not use or access this Website.

Before you place an order, if you have any questions relating to these terms and conditions, please contact our Customer Service team by email, or call us on 03456 049 049 8am - 9pm, 7 days a week.  All calls to Customer Services will be charged at the local rate (BT users only, other network charges may vary), and both inbound and outbound calls may be recorded for quality monitoring and training purposes.

These terms and conditions will apply to all orders for Products which are being delivered within the UK. If your order is for Products which are being delivered outside of the UK , please refer to our International Terms and Conditions.

Alcoholic merchandise

johnlewis.com may sell products containing alcohol. A product contains alcohol if it contains more than 0.5% of alcohol by volume (0.5% abv). Vintages, labels and closures may vary. All wines are 75cl and all spirits and liquors 70cl unless otherwise stated.

Under the Licensing Act 2003 and the Licensing (Scotland) Act 2005, it is an offense to purchase or attempt to purchase alcohol if you are under the age of 18, In addition, in Scotland, liqueur confectionery cannot be sold to any person under the age of 16.

johnlewis.com is committed to upholding both their legal and social obligations as a retailer of alcohol. To achieve this we have a number of control checks throughout the purchase and physical distribution process (e.g. requesting your date of birth when the order is placed and flagging to you that a product is an age-restricted product).

By placing an order on johnlewis.com for any alcohol, you confirm that you are at least 18years old, or at least 16 years old if you are purchasing liqueur confectionery in Scotland.

Please see further details of our age-restricted goods and Challenge 25 policies below, under "Ordering, cancelling and returning products".

In accepting these Conditions you agree to provide johnlewis.com truthful and accurate information and act in accordance with the Licensing Act of 2003.2003 and/or the licensing (Scotland) Act 2005.

DIGITAL MEDIA

Under the Video Recordings Acts of 1984 and 2010, it is an offence to sell an age-restricted DVD or game to a person under the specified age (12, 15 or 18).

By placing an order on johnlewis.com for any age-restricted digital media, you confirm that you are at least the age specified for that digital media. Please see further details of our age-restricted goods and Challenge 25 policies below, under "Ordering, cancelling and returning products".

CHRISTMAS CRACKERS

It is an offence under the Pyrotechnic Articles (Safety) Regulations 2015 to sell Christmas crackers to any person under the age of 12 years old.

By placing an order on johnlewis.com for any Christmas crackers, you confirm that you are at least 12 years old. Please see further details of our age-restricted goods and Challenge 25policies below, under "Ordering, cancelling and returning products".

Ordering, cancelling and returning products

Orders

We will take all reasonable care, in so far as it is in our power to do so, to keep the details of your order and payment secure, but in the absence of negligence on our part we cannot be held liable for any loss you may suffer if a third party procures unauthorised access to any data you provide when accessing or ordering from the Website. Find out more about our Refund policy which is incorporated into these Conditions.

Contract creation and electronic contracting

The technical steps required to create the contract between you and us are as follows:

  • You place the order for your products on the Website by pressing the confirm order button at the end of the checkout process. You will be guided through the process of placing an order by a series of simple instructions on the Website
  • You'll need JavaScript enabled on your computer to buy products and check out. Please enable JavaScript in your browser, then refresh your browser to continue. Alternatively, please call 03456 049 049 to order by phone
  • We may send you an order acknowledgement email as soon as you place your order, and you will receive an order confirmation email detailing the Products you have ordered. These emails do not constitute acceptance of your order
  • For items being delivered to you (as opposed to Click & collect), when your product is shipped from our warehouse we will send you a despatch confirmation email
  • Order acceptance and the completion of the contract between you and us will take place on the despatch to you of the Products ordered unless we have notified you that we do not accept your order, or you have cancelled it in accordance with the instructions in Change or cancel an order
  • For most products sent directly from our warehouse, your credit/debit card will be charged when your order is placed.
  • If the product is being delivered direct to you from a supplier, for instance in the case of larger products such as electrical appliances and furniture, you may be charged at any point between confirmation of your order and despatch. The exact timing of this will vary according to supplier and the product you're ordering

Non-acceptance of an order may be a result of one of the following:

  • The product you ordered being unavailable from stock
  • Our inability to obtain authorisation for your payment
  • The identification of a pricing or product description error
  • Your not meeting the eligibility to order criteria set out in the main Terms & Conditions
  • If you are placing an order for an item that by law is age-restricted, then by clicking the order confirm button you are also confirming to us that you are of at least the legal age required to purchase the product. By clicking the order confirm button, you further acknowledge and consent to us taking steps to verify your age by reference to publicly-available third-party sources.  We reserve the right not to supply any age-restricted product where we reasonably believe that you are below the relevant minimum age. 
  • All age-restricted goods must be received by a person who is at least 18 years old at the time of delivery or click & collect handover. We require this regardless of the relevant age limit for the age-restricted product. As an example, age-restricted digital media with an age restriction of 15 can only be given over at the point of delivery or Click & collect handover to an individual who is 18 years old or over.
  • We reserve the right to request proof of age identification from you if your order contains age-restricted goods, and we are unsure that you are at least 18 years old at the point of delivery or at the point of Click & collect handover. For the delivery or handover of all age-restricted goods, we operate on a Challenge 25 basis, which means that if we think you look under the age of 25, we will ask you to show us proof of age identification. If you are asked for proof of age identification and are unable to provide us with any, we reserve the right to withhold the delivery or Click & collect the order.
  • We reserve the right to limit the number of a given item that can be bought by an individual customer should we deem it appropriate. We also reserve the right to suspend your account and any associated accounts and contact you if we notice an unusual pattern of returns activity or there is other suspicious activity associated with your account or any associated accounts. In the event that this happens you will receive an email not notify you of this
  • Should we have taken payment prior to non-acceptance of your Order then we will refund you, but please note that it can take up to 5 days for the bank to transfer the funds to you

The contract will be concluded in English.

The details of your specific contract will not be filed by johnlewis.com. If you do require any information regarding orders you have placed with johnlewis.com, please write to us at: Customer Services, johnlewis.com, Selectapost 57, Sheffield, S97 3GL

Consumer Contracts Regulations 2013

This legislation offers you the following cancellation rights when you buy online or by phone:

  • You are entitled to cancel your contract if you so wish, provided that you exercise your right no longer than 14 days after the day on which you receive the goods or services.
  • Your right to return or cancel products does not apply to goods that are made to measure or are made to your specification, that have been clearly personalised or which by reason of their nature cannot be returned or are liable to deteriorate or expire rapidly. This doesn't affect your statutory rights if goods are faulty or not as described.
  • If you wish to exercise your right of cancellation, you are obliged to retain possession of the goods and take reasonable care of them.
  • To exercise the right to cancel, you must inform us of your decision to cancel your contract by a clear statement, including details of your name, geographical address, details of the order you wish to cancel and, where available, your phone number and email address.
  • You can cancel by email or call 03456 049 049, or write to: Customer Services, johnlewis.com, Selectapost 57, Sheffield S97 3GL
  • If you decide to cancel, you should return the goods to us at your cost within 14 days of such cancellation and we will reimburse to you (by the method used to pay for the original transaction) the amount in relation to goods to which cancellation rights apply. This includes the cost of delivery (except for the supplementary costs arising if you choose a type of delivery other than our standard and least expensive method of delivery).

     

  • We may make a deduction from the reimbursement for loss in value of any goods supplied, if the loss is the result of unnecessary handling by you. We will make the reimbursement no later than 14 days after the day we receive back from you any goods supplied.

Please see our Refund policy for further details.

Guarantees and accidental damage insurance

We offer guarantees on a number of home and all our electrical products. These guarantees are in addition to your statutory rights.

Between 14 June 2014 - 1 April 2020, accidental damage insurance was available for small appliances, technology and TVs via Added Care. Read more about Added Care including full terms and conditions.

 

Guarantees for large domestic appliances and consumer electronics products

We always honour the manufacturer's guarantee period where offered; these are usually one year unless otherwise stated. Please see individual product pages for details.

In addition to the first year manufacturer's guarantee on all electrical and technology products we provide a second year service guarantee at no extra cost, and it's 5 years on all TVs. We also include a 2-year guarantee on all lighting, except Christmas, solar-powered and nursery lighting.

What does the guarantee cover?

Our guarantees provide full cover against mechanical breakdown through normal use. This means that if your item develops a fault during the guarantee period, we'll arrange for it to be repaired free of charge, including all parts and labour. 

Large domestic appliances include the following ranges of products: washing machines, tumble dryers, washer dryers, dishwashers, fridges, freezers, fridge freezers and cookers (excluding microwaves).

How does it work?

During the guarantee period, if your product develops a fault that needs to be repaired, look for visible signs of the breakdown and consult the fault-finding guide in the manufacturer's handbook, if any.

If that doesn't resolve the issue, please contact your local John Lewis shop and talk to one of our Partners. You'll need to provide us with details of your item, including the model number and date of purchase. You'll find all of this information on our original receipt – this acts as your guarantee, so please make sure you keep it safe.

If we can't repair your item, we'll replace it with an item of equivalent specification (or if you have an electrical lighting product, we may supply spare parts instead). If no equivalent product is available, we'll either offer you the nearest equivalent specification or its selling price value , and we'll always do our best to make sure you're satisfied with the outcome.

What's not included?

There are some specific exclusions from our guarantees, as follows:

  • Repair costs caused by external factors such as computer viruses, faulty software, fire, theft, and weather (including lightning damage)
  • Accidental damage, for example if your item has been dropped. You may find that this type of damage is covered by your household contents insurance policy
  • Image ghosting or screen burn. These can appear on a screen that's left operating for a prolonged period with either a still image or a channel constantly displaying a logo
  • Pixel spots. These are tiny dark or bright spots that may become visible on a screen
  • Digital television picture affected by any of the following: a misaligned or unsuitable aerial, climatic conditions, geographic location, poor quality or low strength broadcast signal
  • Consumables such as batteries, ink cartridges, storage media, rear projection television bulbs, fuses, light bulbs etc
  • Battery-operated toys
  • Nursery, solar-powered and Christmas lighting
  • If the product has been used commercially or for business purposes (with the exception of computers)
  • Data loss
  • Cosmetic damage such as cabinet trim, scratches, dents, corrosion or colour where the function of the product is unaffected
  • Unblocking drainage channels in refrigeration equipment
  • Frozen food loss as a result of the product breaking down
  • Any loss suffered as a result of not being able to use the product, or any loss over and above the purchase price of the original item
  • Servicing, inspecting or cleaning of the product; and failure to follow the manufacturer's instructions and/or installation guidelines
  • Deliberate damage or neglect of the product
  • Please note that our guarantees provide services for goods bought and used in the UK, the Isle of Man and the Channel Islands
Disposal of electrical products and WEEE regulations

WEEE compliance

John Lewis & Partners is a producer of Electrical and Electronic Equipment (EEE) and is therefore obligated under the Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) Regulations. We are fully compliant with all responsibilities as a registered member of a UK government approved WEEE Compliance Scheme, Comply Direct. Our WEEE producer registration number is WEE/DC0065TW.

The UK WEEE Regulations were first introduced in 2007 with the aim of reducing the amount of EEE ending up in landfill. As per the requirements of the Regulations, we finance the recovery and recycling of WEEE when it reaches the end of its life and ensure our EEE products are marked accordingly with a crossed out wheeled bin symbol and a date mark. We also provide information on reuse and environmentally sound treatment of the products.

More information about the WEEE Regulations can be found at www.gov.uk/electrical-and-electronic-equipment-eee-producer-responsibility (opens in a new window), and you can read more here

My John Lewis Review Panel Programme FAQs

WHAT IS THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PROGRAMME?

The My John Lewis Review Programme allows selected My John Lewis members to try and review various products in order to assist other My John Lewis members in finding the best products for them. Customers are invited to join the My John Lewis Review Programme based on their shopping preferences and review history. My John Lewis Review members may be invited to try products that are not yet available on the market - this is where their reviews are the most important. We do not modify or edit reviews as we believe in offering completely honest feedback. They will, however, like all reviews, be subject to our standard moderation guidelines. You can find out more about how to write a helpful review here

 

HOW DO I BECOME A MEMBER?

In order to select the people best suited to the programme, we invite My John Lewis members to join based on their shopping histories, review history and participation in our various events and experiences. If you no longer wish to participate simply email myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk and you will be removed.

 

I HAVE REGISTERED TO THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PANEL, WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

After registering to the My John Lewis Review Panel, you'll start receiving invitations from our team to inform you when new products are available for a trial. We ask that you only accept invitations for trials you are able to complete within 2-4 weeks of receiving the initial invitation email. If you’re chosen as a good match for the trial, you’ll receive another email from us within 10 days. If you haven’t heard from us, maybe check your spam folder in case it’s ended up there. We will do our best to keep you up to date on your application status but if you don’t hear back from us, this means you unfortunately haven’t been selected this time. But please keep an eye out for emails about future product trials. Our team works hard to make sure we match items to those best suited to review them, but sometimes we simply don’t have enough items for everyone to review. If you’re accepted to join the Product trial, we or the supplier will send you your product for review. If you’re unable to try the product within this timeframe, please wait for the next available invitation.

 

WHY HAVEN'T I RECEIVED ANY EMAILS SINCE REGISTERING?

We invite you to participate in specific trials based on the preferences you've shared with us, but also on a random basis. We, therefore, cannot guarantee that you'll be invited to trial every product that becomes available. This means occasionally there may be a gap of weeks, possibly months, before you hear from us.  Please be aware that if we've confirmed your registration and you've verified your email address, you're a member of the Review Panel, and we'll be in touch as soon as suitable products are available for you to review.

 

HOW OFTEN ARE THERE PRODUCTS AVAILABLE TO TRIAL AND REVIEW?

John Lewis runs campaigns regularly and products are available to trial every month.

The number of products in each of the campaigns is limited and John Lewis cannot guarantee all customers who received an email invitation to review new products will receive a product. Once products are confirmed, they will show in your dashboard.

 

I HAVE RECEIVED AN INVITATION TO TRIAL AND REVIEW A LARGE ITEM, FOR INSTANCE, A FRIDGE. WHAT HAPPENS WHEN I REQUEST THIS KIND OF PRODUCT?

When requesting a large product, for instance, a large kitchen appliance, you will need to make sure you have sufficient space in your property and suitable electrical, gas or plumbing connections. John Lewis and suppliers are not able to provide any alterations to your existing furniture or installations at the time of delivering the product. If at the time of the delivery, John Lewis or our trusted suppliers inspect the connection and define it as unsafe, they reserve the right to reject the trial and they won't be able to re-deliver the product.

 WHAT HAPPENS IF I AM UNABLE TO REVIEW PRODUCTS? 

As the programme relies on receiving reviews from our members, it’s important that all members participate in order to secure their place on the panel. Your honest feedback not only helps other customers but also helps inform our suppliers and contribute to product improvements. If you don't provide us with reviews you will be removed from the programme.If you do not want to participate simply email us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk and we can remove you.

 

HOW SHOULD I WRITE MY REVIEW AND WHAT SHOULD I BE REVIEWING?

Please give your honest, unbiased opinion of the product(s) you have tried. Readers also love the practical information - for example, the product’s dimensions, how to use (with any handy tips you can add), and whether it's compatible with other products. If you receive beauty products, don't forget to include some insights into your personal beauty regime. With products that come as a set, such as a shampoo and conditioner, please review each product separately.

Please keep your reviews between 200 and 300 words or approximately 2,000 characters.

 

WHAT SHOULD I NOT INCLUDE IN MY REVIEWS?

There's no need to review standards of packaging, delivery or service as you'll receive your products directly from our suppliers and John Lewis. However, if for any reason, you would like to give feedback regarding your experience with one of our suppliers, simply email us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk.

Please do not mention the price of the product or state that you bought the product yourself as you have received the product free of charge (this will be communicated via a badge next to your review). If you feel that a product is, or is not, worth its price, we suggest you write in terms of 'value for money', without directly mentioning the price.

 

WHAT PICTURES SHOULD I SUBMIT?

When submitting a picture, please make sure these are of reasonable quality and they focus on the product. Your pictures are key in helping others when they are shopping so we suggest making them as professional and exciting as possible. If approved, your picture could be featured in one of our marketing campaigns and will appear on the John Lewis website.

 

HOW DO I SUBMIT A PICTURE/VIDEO?

At the stage you complete your review submissions form, you will be provided with the option to submit a picture and/or video. Simply upload your image and/or video as instructed to include it in your review.

 

I HAVE SUBMITTED MY REVIEW BUT I CAN'T VIEW IT ON THE JOHNLEWIS.COM WEBSITE. WHY?

Please allow up to 72 hours to update. All reviews go through moderation before they are published on johnlewis.com

 

I HAVE SUBMITTED A PICTURE/VIDEO BUT I CAN'T VIEW IT ON THE JOHNLEWIS.CO.UK WEBSITE. WHY?

Images/videos and reviews are moderated separately and we can’t guarantee all pictures will be displayed on the website.

 

DO MEMBERS HAVE TO WRITE POSITIVE REVIEWS TO PARTICIPATE?

No. We expect our members to write unbiased, honest and authentic reviews. All My John Lewis Review Panel reviews will be posted on the relevant product page at johnlewis.com unedited, regardless of whether it is a favourable review or not, provided it follows our general moderation guidelines. For tips on writing a review please click here

 

DO MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW MEMBERS GET PAID FOR WRITING REVIEWS?

No. We do not pay anyone to write reviews. There is no pressure or expectation to write positive reviews, and negative reviews do not affect membership in the programme.

 

ARE REVIEWS COLLECTED THROUGH THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PROGRAMME LABELLED DIFFERENTLY?

Yes. To ensure reviews are helpful and authentic, any reviews gathered through the My John Lewis Review Programme will display a badge with a review panel message and an indicator the product was received free of charge.

 

IT HAS BEEN A WEEK AND I STILL HAVEN'T RECEIVED MY PRODUCT. WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

Most of the products are sent within 5 working days from when the campaign ends. However, if you don't hear from a supplier within 2 weeks and the shipment information has not been shared with you, feel free to contact us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk and we will investigate this further. Before you get in touch, please check your email inbox to ensure no information has been shared with you.

Please note, for large items when a further contact is required to schedule a delivery, it might take up to a month to be contacted by one of our trusted suppliers.

 

WHAT HAPPENS AFTER I APPLY TO SAMPLE A PRODUCT?

Once you have requested your sample you will receive a confirmation email. Those who are most compatible with the product will then be selected to participate in the campaign. We are unable to guarantee that everyone who applies will receive a product to review.

 

CAN I CHANGE MY PRODUCT SELECTION?

Once the product is selected you won’t be able to change your product selection. A campaign will close automatically as soon as all products have been requested. When requesting your product please read all information we shared with you via email inviting you to participate in the campaign to ensure you can comply with all campaign requirements. 

For example, there might be compatibility requirements for electronics that are only compatible with specific software.

 

CAN A SUPPLIER OR JOHN LEWIS CHANGE MY PRODUCT REQUEST?

We would love customers to write and post reviews as quickly as possible but it is important you have had the time to thoroughly use and test the product so that your review is really helpful to other customers.

We ask that you complete your review by the date provided by email. Failure to do so may result in you being removed from our review panel. 

 

WHERE DO I POST MY REVIEW?

After you’ve received your product and the trial period has completed, we will send you an email with the instructions needed to complete your review. This will include a link to the submission form where you’ll be asked to write your review.

 

WILL JOHN LEWIS EDIT MY REVIEW?

No. All My John Lewis Review Panel reviews will be posted on the relevant product page at johnlewis.com unedited, regardless of whether it is a favourable review or not, provided they follow our general moderation guidelines. For tips on writing a review please click here

 

WHERE AND WHEN WILL MY REVIEW APPEAR?

Reviews will appear on the product page relating to the product you have reviewed. Reviews from our Review Programme participants will be displayed a Review Programme logo. As all reviews go through a moderation process, please allow up to 72 hours between the time of submission to the review appearing on the product page.

 

IS THERE A LIMIT TO THE NUMBER OF MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PRODUCTS I CAN REQUEST FOR EACH CAMPAIGN?

For each campaign, we limit the available products to one per member. Occasionally there may be instances where more than one is available and will be accompanied with instructions on how to participate in these campaigns.

 

IF I DON'T SELECT ANY PRODUCTS FROM A CAMPAIGN, WILL I BE REMOVED FROM THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PROGRAMME?

Though we encourage engaging with the programme as much as possible, we understand that this may not be possible with every campaign. However, if we notice you’ve been inactive for longer periods of time, we may be in touch to confirm you’re still interested in participating.

 

CAN YOU DELIVER MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PRODUCTS OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED KINGDOM?

Unfortunately, we cannot support delivery outside of the UK at this time.

 

HOW DO I RETURN, CANCEL OR MODIFY MY REQUESTS?

You can cancel your product selection and arrange to return review products by emailing myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk. The supplier will then arrange a collection.

 

WHAT TYPES OF PRODUCTS DO YOU OFFER THROUGH THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PROGRAMME?

We carefully select products from across various categories for the My John Lewis Review Programme. This could be anything from a state-of-the-art cooker to products from a new haircare line.

 

CAN I INVITE MY FRIENDS TO MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW?

Participation in the My John Lewis Review Programme is limited to selected customers who have received direct invites from us to join.

 

WHY HAVE I BEEN REMOVED FROM THE PROGRAMME?

You may be removed from the My John Lewis Review Programme if you write reviews which do not comply with our terms and conditions, allow non-members to write your reviews for you or share your unique register details with others who have not been invited to the programme. In these instances, we may end your membership without notice. If that happens, you're welcome to contact us for help at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk.

 

WHY WAS MY PARTICIPATION IN A PRODUCT TRIAL CANCELLED?

On occasion, your participation in a product trial may be cancelled. There are several reasons why this might occur, including, but not limited to, product availability, damage to the product during delivery and any other delivery issue.

 

WILL JOHN LEWIS BE SHARING MY CONTACT INFORMATION WITH SUPPLIERS?

The John Lewis Privacy Policy applies to your participation in My John Lewis Review and describes our practices regarding collection and use of personal information. Upon signing the Terms and Conditions, customers agree that their delivery details will be shared for delivery purposes and they will not be used for any other activities.

 

DO I NEED TO RETURN THE ITEM AFTER REVIEWING IT?

No. Products sent to you via the My John Lewis Review Programme are yours to keep. If you want to cancel the item you have selected please contact us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk to arrange this. Please review the Terms and Conditions for further information. Participants must not sell the product; John Lewis reserves the right to request that the product is sent back at any given moment for up to one year.

 

MAY I SHARE PRODUCTS I RECEIVE FROM MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PANEL WITH MY FRIENDS AND FAMILY?

As per the My John Lewis Review Programme Terms and Conditions, you may not sell, exchange, return for money or give possession of the products to any other person or entity.

 

WHO WILL BE SENDING ME MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PRODUCTS?

My John Lewis Review Programme products will be delivered directly by John Lewis or the supplier of the product.

 

HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE FOR ME TO RECEIVE A PRODUCT TO REVIEW ONCE I REQUEST IT?

You should receive your My John Lewis Review Programme product within 2 weeks of confirmation of your participation in a product trial. For larger items, the exact information of delivery will be provided when John Lewis or the supplier of the product contact you to arrange the delivery.

 

WHAT HAPPENS IF I THINK MY PRODUCT IS FAULTY?

If you think your product might be faulty, please contact the supplier support team or the John Lewis Review team at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk

 

I CONTACTED THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PANEL TEAM BUT HAVEN'T HEARD BACK. WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

Our teams do their best to make sure your query is answered as quickly as possible but in some instances, a further investigation is required. If you haven't heard back from us within 5 working days then please email us again at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk . Please note, our inbox is monitored Monday to Friday only, excluding public holidays.

 

I CONTACTED JOHN LEWIS OR THE SUPPLIER'S CUSTOMER SERVICE TEAM BUT THEY CANNOT LOCATE MY ORDER. WHY?

Many products in this programme are sent directly by the suppliers. The products in this programme are supplied free of charge and thus they are not processed as an order. For the quickest troubleshooting please contact the trusted supplier directly or email us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk.

 

HOW DO I UPDATE MY CONTACT DETAILS?

Your contact details can be updated at any time in your dashboard. Simply go to the ‘Profile’ tab and click the edit icon for the details you would like to change. If you would like to change your email address, please contact us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk

 

CAN JOHN LEWIS OR SUPPLIERS UPDATE MY PERSONAL DETAILS?

No, personal details can be only updated by a member, except for your email address which only John Lewis can update.

 

MY PRODUCT WAS SENT TO THE WRONG ADDRESS. WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

John Lewis and our trusted suppliers can only send a product to the address provided in the ‘Profile’ area at the time of requesting the product. If you have moved and changed the address, please remember to update your details in the ‘Profile’ section as products cannot be re-delivered to different addresses. We recommend keeping your account details up to date.

 

HOW DO I REMOVE MYSELF FROM THE MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW PANEL DISTRIBUTION LIST?

If you no longer wish to participate in My John Lewis Review Panel, please send us an email and we will remove you from the programme: myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk.

 

ARE JOHN LEWIS EMPLOYEES ELIGIBLE TO BECOME MY JOHN LEWIS REVIEW MEMBERS?

Yes. John Lewis employees are eligible to participate. Only Partners who meet specific criteria can participate in the initiative. The criteria are set by John Lewis at the time of inviting customers to participate in this review panel. Partners who meet the set criteria and receive their invitations are welcomed to register.

 

I LIVE IN A FLAT, CAN I STILL PARTICIPATE?

Yes, but we ask that you inform us of any access issues should you be receiving a large item. Please contact us at myjlreviewpanel@johnlewis.co.uk

The Beauty Society
  • If you’ve requested a specific Beauty Guide, we’ll do our best to accommodate you but we can’t guarantee that person will be available.
  • Services available to those over the age of 16.
  • You may be asked to remove valuables such as rings prior to beginning your treatment, but we cannot be held responsible for loss or damage to personal items; please keep them with you during your treatment.
  • If you have any health concerns, please raise them with the Beauty Guide before your treatment begins (or if applicable, speak to your doctor prior to booking the appointment). This includes recent surgeries, injuries or allergies. We may be unable to carry out certain treatments if you are suffering with any skin conditions, are taking certain medications, or have had recent tattoos or piercings. Please talk to us before your appointment if you think you may be affected.
  • Although every effort is made to use products suitable for your skin type, we are not liable for any allergic reactions that may occur following your appointment.
  • Please tell us if you’re pregnant, as some products may not be suitable.
  • If you’re late, then your treatment may be reduced or altered to accommodate this, but in some cases we may not be able to carry out the treatment at all and you’ll be asked to rebook your appointment for another time or day.
  • It may not be possible to carry out some treatments if babies or children are present owing to health and safety regulations. Please check when booking your appointment if you plan to bring a child with you.

For changes and cancellation within 24 hours of the appointment, we reserve the right not to refund any deposit you’ve paid.

FAQs

When will I receive my gift card?
You can claim your e-gift card by visiting https://www.johnlewis.com/galaxybook4claim during the claim window 29 April 2024 – 13 May 2024 inclusive. Please return to this page between those dates to find out how to claim. The e-gift card will then be emailed to you within an hour, however, in a limited number of cases, please allow up to seven working days. Please be aware that gift vouchers will be sent via email under the contact name “VEX Promotions''. In some cases these emails can be delivered to junk inboxes, therefore, please check this before calling for further assistance. 

What products are included in the promotion?
Selected Samsung Galaxy Book4 Laptops are the only products included in the promotion. How does this promotion run in conjunction with your after purchase price drop policy around honouring Price Drop requests?
You can successfully submit Price Drop requests on your products after the purchase, and we will still honour your e-gift card claim.

What if I return the qualifying product, can I still claim a gift card?
No, this is why you have to wait for the redemption period before claiming your e-gift card. So we can ensure you haven’t refunded any of the products and the purchase still qualifies for a e-gift card.

What if the qualifying product has another promotion on it?
If the qualifying product has another offer live simultaneously, you can still claim your e-gift

60-night trial on selected John Lewis & Partners mattresses
  • For your peace of mind, we offer a 60-night sleep comfort trial period on selected John Lewis mattresses. To qualify you must purchase a mattress protector in the first transaction. In order for us to offer the best advice on a different mattress, visit your nearest shop for an exchange and we’ll recommend an alternative to suit you.
  • 60 Night Comfort Trial starts on the day of delivery of your John Lewis mattress. The offer is available when we can verify the purchase and delivery date and see a mattress protector in the same transaction.
  • Customers must purchase and use a mattress protector that is purchased in the same transaction as the mattress if the sleep trial is to be valid (as we will not accept any soiled mattresses). Our normal returns policy applies to mattress protectors (non returnable if used).
  • For a Customer to redeem the Trial in order to get the best advice and to try an alternative model, please visit your nearest branch before 60 nights. 
  • The offer is available on all John Lewis mattresses with the exception of ITS, Special Buy, Anyday, House and JLP Essentials. Branded mattresses have their own sleep trial.
  • Customers are entitled to an exchange and not a full refund. A refund of the difference if a cheaper equivalent is chosen; or Customers may pay the difference if a more expensive equivalent is chosen.
  • If purchased originally online, if a higher priced exchange item is chosen, the difference will be processed in store on a Gift Card. Note if refunded, this will go back as store credit.
  • If the original purchase was made using Interest Free Credit, the original transaction will be refunded and a new order and credit agreement placed. Please note that if it is more than 30 days after the original order that a new order is placed, this will result in a second credit search show on your credit history.
  • One exchange per customer is allowed.
  • The exchange must be to the same delivery address as the first sale.
  • There is a customer collection fee for the returning of the unwanted mattress of £29.95.

 

60-day trial on John Lewis & Partners mattresses in selected shops

1. Our 60-Day Mattress Trial starts on the date of delivery and an exchange can be redeemed between 45-60 days. This offer is only available in our Aberdeen, Glasgow, Edinburgh and Newcastle shops. Please visit your nearest shop to redeem. 

2. Only one exchange per customer.

3. The offer is available when we can verify the purchase and delivery date.

4. Customers must buy a mattress protector in the same transaction as the new mattress. The mattress protector must be used with the new mattress for the trial to be valid. Our normal returns policy applies to mattress protectors. They are non-refundable once used.

5. The offer is available on all mattresses, excluding Special Buy, John Lewis Essentials and House By John Lewis.

6. This does not affect other Sleep Trials offered by brands.

7. Customers are entitled to an exchange, a refund of the difference if a cheaper equivalent is chosen, or pay for the difference if a more expensive equivalent is chosen.

8. Delivery must be to the same address as the first sale.

9. Selected postcodes apply.

10. There is a customer collection fee of £29.95 for the returned mattress.
